project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: I would like to be able to order the bar charts in Insight Reports.As seen in my screenshot, the bars are not ordered neither by Attribute name nor the value. It just seems totally random from a users perspective.In my screenshot example, natuarally I would like to able to order either asLowMediumMedium-Highor (by values)2712
fields.summary: Ability to order bar charts in reports

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: A large enterprise customer of ours is managing various custom-developed internal apps as Insight objects.They want to allow developers to upload the individual logos as avatars for each object. However, in the object graph, the default logo configured for the object type should be used to keep the view consistent and easier to understand (cf. screenshots).
fields.summary: Option to alswys use  object default avatar in object graph

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Hello,I need to create a table where I have to show if the particular service is available on AWS/Azure or Ali cloud and put an N if not. Based on this ticket RPS-17407 this functionality is not available on Insight currently.Can you please help me with that?Thanks,Norbert.
fields.summary: Check if service is available on public cloud providers or not

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: As a User, it will be nice to have match the Global Object Search (top Right next to Create Object) capabilities with the Global Search on the Schema view:Currently it is only searching Name (actually "Label"), Key and Type on the New Object Page.Customers are requesting to add anyAttribute, as available on the Schema View
fields.summary: New Object Page: Global Search supports anyAttribute

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Dear mindville teamPlease enable other schema and object roles to create print label templates. Currently this is restricted to the Schema Manager and Insight Admins. I believe, it would be useful if schema and object type developers would also have the ability to create such templates.Best regardsSebastian
fields.summary: Print Label Template creation to be enabled for more roles

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: When typing using IME method (input method editor. These are installed on users' operating systems and provide methods for users to input various characters from languages like Chinese, Japanese, and Korean.) pressing enter will save the attribute instead of just adding the text from the IME to the attribute name . This adds more load to the user to either use a word editor then copy and paste or may cut the string down in the middle of the sentence.h2. RequirementAdding IME support for Insight (listen on keydown)
fields.summary: Enable IME typing for attribute names

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: When exporting an object to CSV, it does not include the inbound references? We are trying to export a property receipt for our users to sign with their linked workstations and assets, but the export functionality in Insight seems VERY limited and almost useless. We have several tools that we use in JIRA to make customizable export templates, but none of them seem to be able to interact with Insight.
fields.summary: Export inbound references

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Vore kanon om det fanns möjlighet att välja vilka attribut som man ville skulle visas på ett objekt i en selectlista.Idag ser man bara namnet på objektet.Man kan idag konfa vilka attribut som ska visas i view läget på ett JIRA ärende men det är oftast lite för sent för användaren, dvs. användaren vill kunna se attributen redan vid skapandet av ärendet och det är lite för jobbigt att klicka på förstoringsglaset och kolla på attributen där.
fields.summary: Möjlighet att välja attribut i selectlista

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Allow us to sort the Automation Rules. Alphabetically would be great.
fields.summary: Automation Rules - Feature Request

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: It should be possible to reindex specific object types
fields.summary: Reindexing specific object type

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Could be an option in Insight Configuration (Manage add-ons) to be able to choose a default number of objects to be shown. Currently we show the first 25.
fields.summary: Possible to set default objects to be shown not only the first 25

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: I would suggest you provide filters to arrange the rules (at a minimum alphabetically).
fields.summary: Sorting of automation rules

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Please provide concrete examples in your documentation. E.g. it is difficult to understand how exactly the JSON file should be formatted by just reading the text here: [https://documentation.riada.se/display/ICV51/JSON+Import]It also think it would be nice to be able to comment things like this directly in the documentation rather than having to create an issue here.
fields.summary: Documentation: Examples and commenting

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Hi,Currently we need to make changes to each pat file (Discovery Import) to convert the Mb to Gb for every build. This is a manual activity and we want this as a configurable parameter in UI screen.
fields.summary: Calculated Attribute - Converting Mb to Gb

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Hi Riada,The new visual Tree Graph is really nice! Great work!It would be very helpful though if you could make the tree vertical!Thanks guys!
fields.summary: Tree Graph Vertically

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Hello,the object attribute type "URL" appears to only allow some default protocol handlers (https, ftp, ...), others don't work.We would have the need to create links to other applications, one example would be IBM Notes which uses the protocol "notes://".
fields.summary: Allow all protocol handlers in attribute type URL

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: At the moment it's not possible to reorder attributes.In our case we have an important field ("assigned user") at the very end of the attributes list. It's always a pain to find that field when we need to update it.It would be great it we could re-order these fields (at least somehow in the database).
fields.summary: Reorder object attributes

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Hi,currently if I open an Object, the "History"-Tab of that Object is shown oer default in the Activity-Section.It would be great if there could be a configuration to set the default behaviour: History or CommentsFor us: Comments are more interessting than the history.
fields.summary: Default Configuration of activ tab in Object view

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: When using the Export -> Printable view in JIRA on an issue, only the object name/ID is printed. Is there a way to have this way show the same information that appears on the JIRA Issue screen when viewing from a computer so that the printable view is representative of the issue. We are using a customer type object with many attributes and none are printed in the printable view.
fields.summary: Viewing a JIRA issue with Insight Objects, printable view shows the attributes.

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Currently in Insight, managing the field options for "select" attribute types is horrible.It does not even default to an alphabetical order, which would be an ideal fix for what we're looking to do, but more robust controls could help others as well.
fields.summary: Intuitive way to manage "Select" fields

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: We have many objects that have inbound references of the same object types but with differents reference types. In the object view we can't see what inbound reference objects come from which reference type.Because the inbound reference type is a very important information to our object scheme, we need to see the inbound reference type of each object connected (we will be happy too if it's grouped first by object type and then grouped by reference type or vice versa).We are now using API REST to get the information but our majority of users are more comfortable with the Insight navigation to get the assets information(faster and easier to use).¿Could you please take in consideration for next releases?Thanks
fields.summary: Inbound References View inside an Object

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: These seem like minor things, but they actually impact the separation of duties between a couple of vendors we have.We need to remove OS level access from routine Insight maintenance and use.1: When persisting the Insight index to disk, the WebUI shows that the task is complete, while the OS shows that the indexes are still be written. This takes a few minutes on our instance. The WebUI shouldn't mark the task as complete until all files are actually written. I shouldn't have to repeat (`ls -ail /path`) and wait until 15 seconds or so to make sure no filesizes are increasing.2: While you're there, I'd list all 5 index files w/ full locations, and sizes. Seems trivial enough to do (where the index path is currently listed).3. When starting a new node, manually copying index files from another node requires OS level logins, and it's kind of a pain. I mentioned this way long ago, but on DataCenter editions, can a persist-to-disk also copy it to the shared home location, so the newest indexes are always in the share? Then, at startup, Insight could copy the shared indexes to the local home directory? Would save a lot of time.Thanks.
fields.summary: Feature Requests: Index Persistence in DataCenter

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: As per [RPS-7584|https://portal.riada.se/browse/RPS-7584] , The client would like to see his IQL filter applied too on the simple filter. Why does the IQL honor the advanced IQL and not the simple filtration ?
fields.summary: IQL Filtering - IQL to honor simple filtering

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Currently you cannot set date type attributes as labels. Hence, if all your objects are labeled as dates you will not be able to sort them unless you add an attribute date, show it and then sort the objects by list view.
fields.summary: UI - Add the ability of sorting attributes with dates in the detail view

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: We sometimes have trouble differentiating between users of similar names because the custom field view is not wide enough (our JIRA's user directory is > 60000 users). The list should be made wider (maybe user selectable via field configuration), or at least, it could display the complete user information when hovering over a given name (the latter should be easier to implement). !image-2018-11-22-13-53-57-288.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Display the full name when have duplicates of the same object name

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: In our Jira environment we have thousands of different versions in almost 2000 projects. We would like to have insight objects that let the user select a project and a version. Project and version information are provided by the Insight attribute Types Project and Version. The project selection works fine. There are only 25 projects shown at any time and 'smart search' allows to quickly find the project you want. Version selection however is almost impossible. Once the users clicks on the dropdown button, the list begins to load an causes the browser to throw some script error. This is presumably caused through the enormous amount of versions Insight has to fetch. The selection only works if the version name is already known an can be quickly entered into the attribute field before it tries to load all versions. Then smart search limits the amount of selectable verisons and the select list is loaded without crashing.It would be nice to allow a prefiltering of the version attributes, as it is possible with attributes of the 'Inisght Object' Type. In our case that could be through an IQL placeholder. The user would then first select the Jira project and afterwards all versions stored in the project could be fetched. The limitiation to that specific project might be handled by the IQL placeholder statemenst, as we already know from queries in Insight custom fields etc.
fields.summary: Prefiletering for Attributes (of the Type Version) on object creation

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: We’d like to be able to see additional attributes on the Customer Portal beyond the “Label” when searching. For comparison, searching for “Parkway” in the Customer Portal:Agent view:The attributes that are configured for searching in the agent view are done here:Is there a way to do this for the customer portal? (it is not obvious to me if there is)
fields.summary: Additional Attributes on Customer Portal for searching

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: We regularly use the "Clone" feature on objects that have attachments and would like the ability to choose to clone the attachment or not (checkbox as in the 'Clone' feature in Jira).This will substantially reduce the time we spend doing manual operations in Insight.
fields.summary: Clone feature - Attachment option

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Currently we have two Jira systems (Software and Service Desk).We have integrated Insight into our Jira Service Desk to support our systems/customers.We also use the Confluence AddOn to read data from Insight and use it on our Confluence pages (system documentation).It would be nice, to get an AddOn for Jira Software, as already possible with Confluence. Thus, we would be able to use the data (information) in our development processes too. We just want to read the data, no edit/add required. Your support told us that the only option to do this, is to install a second Insight with exporting/importing from Service Desk.But then we would need a second license, which will be to expensive for our use case. The data won´t be used in every issue, only if needed.
fields.summary: AddOn for JIRA software to use data from Insight

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: When I display service desk tickets in the queue view of service desk, I can also display columns with Insight objects. There, only the object label is shown (e.g. a customer number). This is not very useful for service desk agents as they would like to know the customer name and not only the number at a glance (without clicking on or hovering over the object first). I would like to configure this so that additional attributes can be shown in the object. This would be similar to the ticket view where custom Insight fields can be configured to show multiple Insight attributes instead of just the label.
fields.summary: Show multiple insight attributes in service desk table views

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: h2. Use Case If you have a very long attribute name and you are trying to create an object. Then you wish to pick that attribute but you have now two attribute that are called the same in the beginning of the string and the difference is only in the end.h2. ProposalThat can be remedied if we allowed the user to see the full name via a tooltip or a hover action
fields.summary: Create object - Allow the user to see long object names

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Good Morning,When importing from Discovery I would like to import several import types (eg VIRTUAL_GUEST and HOST) in the same object types in Insight. Unfortunately this is not possible because I can only create one import per object type.It would be nice if you can import several import types into one object type.regards
fields.summary: Several import types for in object type

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: It's fundamental problem of Insight - you mix two main views in one and it's not good.What we see now is not object browser, it's types browser!For example i have following tree of object types with inheritance of attributes: * Hardware ** Rack  ** Rackmount *** Server *** Switch ** Standing *** Computer *** Printer * Location ** Office ** Datacenter * Host ** Physical ** Virtual It's very hard to navigate on such tree to find anything installed in rack1 or in office room2We need an object browser constructor to be able browse related objects in single tree like this: * Datacenter ** Rack *** Server **** Phisical host ***** Virtual host *** Switch * Office ** Computer ** PrinterPlease think about it. Thanks!
fields.summary: Separate tree for browsing and object hierarchy types/attributes

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: It is possible to create a comment on all objects independently of what role you have. I would like to suggest to have a configuration so that I can choose if I want all to create comments or only Manager and Developer for a specific object type (or schema).In my case I want to block read only users (Object Schema Users) to comment on all smal configuration objects. It is good to have communication but I would like to steer it in a more appropriate channel so that: * We do not miss out on important feedback (we could create an automation that always detects when a comment is created on those objects, but I see that as overkill) * I do not want people to have long discussion threads connected to an object (and sometimes discussions tends to drift away from the subject)
fields.summary: Block read only users to create comments

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: I would like a function with which one can adjust, with which age entries in the activity log should be deleted. With many changes, the log becomes very long in the long term with information that is no longer needed.
fields.summary: Delay to delete activity log

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: h2. UsecaseThe history changes are saved in the DB as text format and not as a link to the object. You can check the history as explained on our [documentation|https://documentation.riada.io/display/INSSERV/Objects+-+REST] using the rest call{{GET /rest/insight/1.0/object/\{ID}/history}}This will return the information in text based and thus has no linkage, a sample example IP history change{code:java}   "id": 38840,        "affectedAttribute": "IP Address",        "oldValue": "198.163.1.2",        "newValue": "198.163.1.14",        "type": 5,        "created": "08/Jul/19 2:49 PM",        "objectId": 923 {code}(Both IPs are values to an attribute of type object)h2. ProposalTo turn these values into hyperlinks to their respective objects instead of being plain text
fields.summary: Make the objects in the history tab linking to their adjacent objects

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Hello,It would be convenient to display custom quick filters in the Object Schema view screen, so custom made filters saved by the administrator of Insight could be available directly from this screen and not only in the "Search for Object" view or the Reports.Would you consider implementing this feature?Kind regards
fields.summary: Add quick filters to Object Schema view

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: By default, in column view, Insight displays only the Key, Name, Created and Updated fields. It would be useful if administrators could change the default columns in the columns view so that users see more useful fields in the first instance. It would be good if these defaults could be configured on an Object Type. !image-2019-08-30-09-58-53-142.png!
fields.summary: Allow Administrators to set the default view for an Object Type for all users

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: In addition to the "Select List" and "Checkbox/Radio Button" field types, can there be an "Autocomplete" type which only returns suggestions based on a typed search and not start with a populated drop down.
fields.summary: Custom fields - Add autocomplete option

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: When using the "Select List" field in the customer portal, indicate in the select list if there are more entries than shown (if the number of objects exceeds the default 25 or custom configured limit). And for internal Agent view, indicate the type to search is an option.
fields.summary: Custom fields - add an indication number of objects on cf in the portal

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: It's possible to use the custom field (CF) type _Insight Object/s_ as a referenced field with placeholders, but only if the CF that the _Insight Object/s_ CF is referring to is visible in the customer portal (ie. not hidden in the form). The possibility to use an _Insight Object/s_ CF as a referenced field to 100 % would minimise the amount of CFs we need to create and maintain.*Example*I have a CF called Genres, it's an _Insight Object/s_ field. If I want to filter the objects shown in that CF based on predefined value/s in the request type, I have to create yet another CF called Genres to make it work. I could of course call it something else, but that doesn't look good for the users/agents.This is yet another CF that I don't want to create and it confuses the users when they search for tickets and use the "incorrect" field Genres to find tickets.More details in this support ticket, if needed for clarification: [https://portal.riada.io/plugins/servlet/desk/portal/12/RPS-11897]
fields.summary: Insight Object/s to work as References Object

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: It would be nice to be able to order the Automation Actions so that they are executed top to bottom e.g.  # Http Request  (GET) # Http Request  (DELETE) # Attribute Valueor to be able to call another Automation as an action.
fields.summary: Streamline Automations execution

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Hi,In order to visualize our asset portfolio, I'd like to filter away some of the links to objects.See pictures.
fields.summary: Insight - I want to be able to filter out object links in Tree diagram

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Currently, QR code generation in the Label Printer uses 200px by default and cannot be changed. The dimensions of the picture can be changed but not the resolution. Alternatively, "Print QR code" allows you to select pick four separate resolutions. New feature would allow you to select the resolution of the QR code when inserting it into your Label Template.
fields.summary: Improve ability to alter resolution of QR code in Label Printer

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: In Insight I want to customize the filters themselves. I do not want all filters to be present, but I want to have a set of filters that I “whitelist” for Insight usage.Suggestion/feature request here is: * In Insight Object Scheme configuration, create a new tab “Filters” * Add bullet-choice/select boxes with the choices for filter availability: ** Use currentUser available JQL filters ** Use pre-defined filters only ** Use both pre-defined and currentUser available filters * Add a list where one can add JQL-filters * Add a function to populate that list based on existing Object Scheme (maybe this needs to be set by a Jira Administrator depending the users permission in multiple schemes) * Have the “Connected Jira Issues” function in Object view present filters reflection the choices in the above selection.
fields.summary: better handling JQL filters for Connected Jira Issues

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: When using the "Select an object" option in the customer portal, the click to select functionality can be confusing for users. What happens is that if you click on the name in the object in the panel it will not *select* the object, but clicking on it after it is selected will *deselect* it. To select an object in the list, you need to click on the white space between the object name and the show graph icon. To de-select, you can click on the object's name/label and the selected icon, but not the white space between the name/label and selected icon.This inconsistency confuses our users on how to select/deselect those objects.Testing for above was in Insight 8.3.1, however the behavior is different in 8.2.1 where all the selection and deselection is only in the white space between the name/label and selected icon. Clicking on either of these items does not select or de-select.
fields.summary: Improvement Request: Object picker selection/deselection

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: I am setting up an Insight system and I love the available option of "Bulk Actions" (keep, Remove, Change, Add). Unfortunately, this feature is not available for Automation rules.*Excepted result*I like to suggest to have the same feature available for the Automation section. With this feature, I can add or remove object references based on available data.Example:Group memberships are imported to Insight every night. If an user is a member of group A, service B will be assigned. Afterwards, the users can raise support tickets via JSD. If an user was remove from group A, the assignment of service B will be removed automatically.*Actual result*At this moment I am only allowed to add values to a specific attribute. More manual work is needed to keep the CMDB updated!Besides, the documentation doesn't say what happens it the attribute "Value" field is kept empty.*Workaround*Delete relevant attribute values before starting the re-importer.
fields.summary: Same Features for Automation Rules like Bulk Actions

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Please support other protocols than HTTP for URL attributes *Example:*With our Cisco telephone system we are able to directly call an user by clicking his/her phone number = [ciscotel:+49123456789]Currently, Insight doesn't match the input to this attribute to a URL so no link is provided to the user.
fields.summary: Support of other protocols in URL attributes

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: If multiple schemas have a reference to an object, there is no way to filter the reference from a particular schema.For example, there is schema A and Insight Discovery schema (B) and C.Schemes B and C have a Host object that references the Host in scheme A.At the moment I can find Host objects in schema A that have a reference to themselves of other schemas using the query " object having inR(objecttype = Host)", but find objects referenced only by schema B I can't. I could if a query like "object having inR(schema = 'Insight Discovery' and objecttype = Host) "was available.Using different types of references for each schema is not convenient for a large number of schemas.
fields.summary: Filter a reference from a specific schema.

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Hello, we'd like to create a script which sends an email to users every time a new asset is found. Could you send an example script we could use? We'd like to use the Insight Automation Engine to accomplish this task.
fields.summary: Automation Rule for Notifications

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: In the current Insight Azure Integration (IAI - 1.7.0) when we import Azure's structure some Object Types  are missing:. Event Hub. Kubernates. SQL managed instance. Logic AppIs it possible to intercept and load them?Best regards,Damiano
fields.summary: Add "Kubernetes", "Logic App", "Event Hub" & ​"SQL managed instance"  to Azure importer

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: We are looking to identify Groups that were provisioned from Microsoft Teams, in our Azure Insight Object Schema, where we are using the Insight Azure Integration import. Is there any way that we can have a new synced attribute for the following PowerShell command?{quote}Get-Unifiedgroup | Where-Object \{$_.ResourceProvisioningOptions -eq 'Team'}{quote}If ResourceProvisioningOptions is added, we can report upon the attribute and create automations based on this Object.
fields.summary: Insight Azure Integration - Adding Group ResourceProvisioningOptions From Azure

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: My company uses Azure Front Door services for a few different situations in our cloud environment. I would like the ability to import that Front Door information to keep track of it, monitor for changes, etc.
fields.summary: Add Azure Front Door services to import options

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Hi,We are starting to get Azure information into our schema. We are focus on Intune information and I notice that there is not selector for aplications informations. In Intune we have this kind of data and I want to khow if is posible to bring it to the schema. Thank you in advance. I atacht some screanshots of the data in Intune.
fields.summary: Applications Information

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: We are using "Insight Azure Integration 1.7.2" and the following attributes are not available in the "Virtual Machine" object :- AHUBSQL- Cores- SkuOfferHow can we make the import return the value of these attributes ?Thanks,
fields.summary: Request to add more Attributes in the Azure integration

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: I'm using the AWS Integration module and I'd like to know if I can retrieve some custom attributes from EC2 instances, such as the versions of applications running on them (eg. a local database such as MySQL or PostgreSQL, Apache Web Proxy, etc...).Note: SSM agent is well installed on the servers, and the appropriate role is well attached to them.Maybe you could create an option in your App and let the user provides an S3 bucket if he wants to?What I want is not an object or an attribute provided by AWS, but something that comes from what's inside an EC2 instance (in my case, the versions of various softwares).
fields.summary: Retrieve custom attributes from EC2 instances

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: AWS integration seems to currently have limitations regarding large environments, our case is a AWS environment with 200+ accounts, and we are unable to import data in a meaningful timeframe for the implementation to be viable.Two improvements that could help with this:1) Ability to create configurations via code (API or such): We could manage the problem by creating separate import configurations for each accounts, but doing this by hand will not be sustainable in the long run2) Further optimizing the import process: Trying to put more than 10-20 accounts to a single import process will cause it to crash since the import takes more than an hour which in turn causes the AWS access token to expire. The import tool does not handle this exception and becomes stuck.Also the import tool seems to(?) fetch all object types from a single accounts before moving to the next one, is it possible to improve this to run the import in a more parallel way? Do you have any suggestions on how we could improve our configuration or if any improvements on the AWS integration can be expected in the coming year?
fields.summary: AWS Integration unable to fetch data from large environments

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: The current Google Cloud integration (1.3.1) only imports a small subset of configurations as opposed to the AWS importer.We would really like to see more discovered types able to be imported from GCP, particularly Kubernetes (GKE).
fields.summary: Add Kubernetes to GCP importer

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: With the import module for "JIRA Environment Import" I would like to be able to import configuration from other (remote) JIRA instances.I would like to be able to, as in the module "BitBucket Environment Import", specify a JIRA instance's Base URL, Username and Password.
fields.summary: Ability to import from other JIRA instances

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: It would be amazing to have also Boards and Dashboards synchronized!
fields.summary: Board- and Dashboard Synchronization

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: It would be amazing if I could manage Multiple Insight Jira & Bitbucket - ObjectSchemes within one "Master" Object Scheme. This would probably cause a mature Change for Insight Core, but it's worth it!
fields.summary: Import-Feature for multiple Configurations

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Dear Riada,Could you implement transition from Workflows and post function object types in the Jira Integration for Jira Environment import?Thank you
fields.summary: Transition and post function object types

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: The Jira Configuration importer to Insight does not currently import JSD data. This would be extremely good to understand how the structure of Service desks are built up. Especially as there are no configuration schemes for JSD.This info should be imported:*PRIO 1*Request type Group * NameRequest type * Connected Issue type * Request type GroupsFields * Connected custom field * Display name * Required field(yes/no) * Description * Hidden field (yes/no) * Preset value*PRIO 2*SLA * NameCalendar * Name * Timezone * Start/end time Mon-SunHoliday * Name * Each year * Date * Connected CalendarCustomer Organisation * Name * Connected Jira projectWorkflow statuses * Connected Request type * Status * Display name on portal
fields.summary: JSD - include more information to be fetched from JSD

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: [Documentation|https://documentation.mindville.com/display/IAE/BitBucket+Environment+Import], as well as the Integration's Selector includes COMMIT.However - the Object type is not at all documented, nor there are any Datalocators when using COMMIT as Selector.The Attribute "Latest Commit" in the Branch Object Type brings in a Hash Value, and no further details.Can you please add the Commit Object Type and Datalocators to the BB Integration? (in the screenshot bellow - used the wrong Selector to force the Validation error - showing that COMMIT is a valid Selector...): !image-2020-09-22-11-39-58-473.png!
fields.summary: Improvement Request: Insight Bit Bucket Integration - Commit Object Type

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Hello,We like to set up insight for Jira Service Desk ticket submitting. We will print the QRcode access labels for customer equipment. When there's an issue, customers can scan and submit tickets. Our support can reference the asset info.Currently, the QRCode URL can only direct back to the Insight page.Please advise if there's an option to do so.This is for Insight for Jira Cloud version 1.1.7-AC.Thanks!
fields.summary: QRCode Customization option

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Hi,There is a field in Snow that I can't find as Data Locator when I'm setting up the object type mapping.The field Version that is showing the version of the operating system and service-pack when looking at a server. !image-2020-10-01-08-45-22-331.png! Maybe there are more fields the integration does not support? The environment: Jira Software: 8.5.3Insight: 8.6.6Insight Snow Integration: 1.4.3Snow: Version 9.7 Revision 01 Build 7552
fields.summary: Add support for more fields to sync from

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: I'd like to request that the "Most Frequent User" and "Most Recent User" filters from SNOW are available for import.The SNOW import currently can bring through various options about a Computer object but it's lacking the choice to show these as data locators.Computer objects currently don't have any link back to a User object so this feature would be useful.I'm currently working on an asset tracking project and this information would be very useful.Thanks
fields.summary: Include "Most Frequent User" and "Most Recent User" to SNOW Imports

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Instead of writing IQL queries, it will be great to have sort by column(similar to object list view) in "Search for objects".
fields.summary: Sort by column feature

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Hey, I would like to request a new feature for the Insight Macro for Confluence. That is to use a similar functionality to the Insight Object picker for JIRA (see attached screenshot).This will allow us to have users search for objects in our schemas straight out of Confluence. Not needing to jump into Jira and Insight, finding the correct schema and search for objects in there. Instead having the ability to search, cross schema, for anything that you have access to.Then we can build a "portal" for searching our Insight structure in Confluence. For example, we have all our Jira projects here, Bitbucket repos, Systems, Teams, Users, Groups, Responsibilities. Users who are looking for what team X does, can go here and see all their related projects, repos, systems, responsibilities etc. Or someone might find a broken cable in a meeting room - then you can go to the Insight "Portal" and look for who's responsible to fix it.That's a very user friendly way to provide the data to everyone.Thanks for reading. Hope you can consider this to be a feature in the Insight Macro for Confluence.Emil
fields.summary: Insight Object Picker Macro in Confluence

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: If Confluence has Application Links to multiple JIRA instances, it is only possible to select Object Schemas for the Insight for Confluence macro from the Application marked as "Primary".It would be very helpful if it was possible to specify both JIRA instance and Object scheme in the Macro's configuration.
fields.summary: Unable to pick Insight Object Schemas from non-primary JIRA instance

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Hello,i'd like to display the attributes of the referenced objects, is that possible ? For examplemy iql: objecttype ="Firewall" and object HAVING inboundReferences(objecttype ="Serviceplan") And i want to display the firewalls with their own attributes and also the description of Serviceplan which is referenced to the firewall.
fields.summary: inboundReferences attributes

Some clients wish to be able to filter on those results too.Would also be great to be able to change the sort of the attributes as well same as in Jira by clicking on the attribute name (change the sort direction) A-Z , 1-9,..etc

fields.description: *Scenario* # Use the macro to display a list of insight object that is longer than the screen (example 100 rows) # Save the page # View the table on the page and scroll down. # Table headers disappears as soon as they reaches the top of the page.*Expected results*Table headers should be visible when scrolling down a long table.Similar as the Freeze Panes (first row) in Excel.
fields.summary: Keep table headers visible when scrolling down

fields.description: We are missing the feature to be able to list Comments in Insight Objects macro.Today its only possible to list attributes
fields.summary: Use object comments in Insight Objects macro

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: When creating a Blueprint for a certain type of object (asset) I would love to add a macro which uses an IQL depended on another IQL result set in another macro on the same page. Similar to Jira.Like:Macro 1 - IQL: objectType = company and Name = "X"Macro 2 - IQL: objectType = product and Distributor in (Macro 1)Do you get the point?

fields.description: In Insight I can configure an attribute as following:For default type "Integer" and "Float" you can choose to add the values and display the sum of the attribute values. I want to show the sum of these attributes by using the Insight Macro for Confluence.
fields.summary: Show the sum of the attribute values

fields.summary: hide the attribute names in single item view

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Hi, It would be great to incorporate a pattern that would pick up the model and serial number of the monitor. It would give us a full picture of the asset we have. I've attached a powershell script which does just that and would be great if it's Incorporated in ID.
fields.summary: Retreive Monitor Serial Numbers

fields.description: When we are able to transfer pattern files remotely, there should be an option to delete them remotely.Manually deleting across 1000s of machine is not a solution. Or either the Discovery agent should have some configuration like Discovery to ignore the pat files and process the rest

fields.description: Customers would like to have the option to configure Discovery on non GUI Systems.

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h2. Usecase
An SNMP switch can report on which host is connected to which port on that switch. Hence, Discovery should be able to fetch this information.

h2. Requirements
Discovery to be able to scan the connected ports and add this information to the Network interface to an attribute called _Connected Port_
fields.summary: Network interface - Allow devices to identify the port a device is connected to

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Hi, It would be super helpful to incorporate a warranty check pattern in ID. It's already being done by the asset management tool Device42 which retrieves device warranty info directly from manufactures like Dell, HP, Lenovo and IBM. This would be incredibly helpful in managing the life cycle of our assets.https://docs.device42.com/auto-discovery/warranty-autodiscovery/
fields.summary: Retreive Device Warranty Info via API

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: I propose to create a new objecttype Network using existing "Network Interface" attributes IP4 and Subnet4."Network Interface" should reference Network it belongs to. {noformat}Example:IP4 = 172.19.36.91   Subnet4 = 255.255.255.0  Network => 172.19.36.0/24 (Name="172.19.36.0/24", "Network IP4 address"=172.19.36.0, "Network Subnet4"=255.255.255.0){noformat}
fields.summary: New objecttype Network

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Hello,It would be nice if you could hide reference types from the Inbound Reference screen. It looks bad in the case of objects that have a lot of references.!image-2021-04-29-09-39-54-348.png|width=259,height=156!ThanksTomasz
fields.summary: Hide references type on Inbound references screen

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: We have the recurring need to specify a 'main' system which is the only one to create new objects via Import.Here's an example:- I would like to create computer Accounts based on the data available in SCCM.- Also i would like some additional information for the accounts available in SCCM from the Active Directory.The problem i'm running into is that, as most ADs i've seen to far, it's not the cleanest system and there's a lot of outdated or unused computer accounts, which would now also be created as objects.So in this case i would like the SCCM import to be the "main system" to be able to create objects and i would like the AD import only to add data to existing objects.Long story short: We need an option in the import "do not create new objects, only update existing ones"I am sure many customers will appreciate this feature as well.Thank you and best regardsThomas
fields.summary: Import feature - "Do not create new objects"

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Although you can now populate an Attribute with a Value AFTER an Object is Created using Automation and Attribute Value - we still get requirements to have an Attribute populated by a Default Value visible on the Create Screen, even before the Create Object form is submitted.
fields.summary: Default Attribute Value on the Create Object Screen

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: From the customer portal, new objects can be created using the "Create an Insight Object from a Jira Issue" postfunction and existing objects can be edited using the "Set the value of an object attribute with a predefined value" postfunction using placeholders.Absent is the ability to copy issue attachments to an object being created and object having attributes edited. I'd like if this functionality could occur in a postfunction and include the option to add all issue attachments or the last issue attachment.
fields.summary: Copy issue attachments to insight object via post-function(s)

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: When importing - it will be nice to also set a Static Value on Attributes that are not mapped with a Data locator.for example, This will allow setting an initial Status to an Object, which will then be updated if the object is missing from the next import.We do have this functionality in Discovery....
fields.summary: Static Value for Attribute on Import

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

We are missing one important level for permissions, based on the Object itself.

When enabling an Insight Schema to JSW Portal means that ANYONE can view the Object's Label values (all Values in the Text Attribute designated as Label).
 This is a limitation due to JSW Portal's requirements.

*Use-case:*
 In an object we have a user attribute called *Owner*

We want the user set as *Owner* in each object being able to e.g. edit the object (but no other objects)

This would enhance the usability a lot since we don't have to open up entire schemas to many users just to be able to update a few objects.
fields.summary: Permission at Object Level

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: We have teams that use service internally and link their projects to insight for asset management. We would like to be able to allow those users to have the ability to create an object from that portal similar to how an agent of the service desk can from the project.
fields.summary: Ability to create Insight Object from an Atlassian Service Desk Customer portal

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Currently if a user inputs/updates an object there is a manual calculation that has to be done to get a final number in our Total Mileage field. If there was a way for attributes to calculate based on the entries of one another it would certainly help. !image-2019-04-17-14-36-51-282.png!
fields.summary: Attribute Calculation

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Hello.We are using Insight as a service catalog with miltiple choice.For us this service catalog is an hierarchical work set for content studio (production of banners, html emails, differend kinds of posters and other things). When customer creates an issue - he chooses what work should be done (picture in attachment). But each work item may have quantity - for example, customer wants 5 little banners, 10 big banners and 2 html emails.We wish that there will be fuctionality, when customer could set quantity of each item while issue creating. And this number should be accessed with different scripts, as we want to multiply number of each item on it's price (price of item is an object attribute in our Insight) and calculate total cost of one issue.As a workaround we split issue it subtasks and set quantity in subtasks, but it is not very comfortable.We think this functionality may also be needed in classic IT services, when an employee needs 2 monitors. 3 cables, etc. Not only in specific field of activity, such as content-studio.We will be grateful for the consideration of this request.Thanks
fields.summary: Setting the number of required objects while issue creating

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Hey guys,at the moment you have 3 parameters that can be set in the post function: * Source Custom Field * Change Type * Target Custom FieldThat results in the behaviour that Insight will write the Object Value in each Attribute that fits the object Type.What we need is the extension to choose an Attribute based on a custom Field. So the fourth parameter would be: * ~ Attribute Custom Field*Expected Behaviour:* You can choose from all (insight) custom fields which will result in the possibility to write the insight object only in a specific attribute.*Use Case:* We want to automize our permission management. For that case we want to write the user objects in the related roles which should be attributes in the application object (e.g. Jira, Confluence etc. with attributes: Admin, User, Agent etc.) If you'd like to discuss that feature please do not hesitate to contact me!Best RegardsJulian
fields.summary: Extend Post Function Parameters for "Change Insight Value into Insight Object"

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: We would like an advanced search functionality (preferebly a GUI based one and not with IQL) from a custom field so we can find all assets with e.g. a certain relation and/or certain attributs.Use case: today you can search for assets from the custom field but for us this search funtionality is very limited since we need to be able to drill down in the structure to very specific assets for each Jira ticket. We can´t do it by sorting the field itself with an IQL since we need all the assets to be available to choose from. This advanced search also needs to be done in a user friendly way so a GUI based one like the "Basic Search" is therefore prefereable.
fields.summary: Better search and relate function from a Jira ticket
